info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 20 at 1:57PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STORMY START TO THE WEEK... Southeast Alaska should ready for periods of rain, light snow, and wind through at least mid-week. While a weaker storm presses northward across the Panhandle through Monday, a stronger storm approaches the Panhandle from the south. This storm arrives with strong, gusty winds; rainfall; and higher elevation snow late Monday into Tuesday. Precipitation totals from late Monday afternoon through late Tuesday afternoon range from 0.5 to 1.5 inch from Baranof Island and Kake northward and from 1 to 2 inches from Petersburg south. Widespread gusty winds of 40 mph or more are expected from Monday night through Tuesday across the region.
